+package org.tensorflow;
body:
Do you think it makes sense for this to be in the `org.tensorflow.ops` package instead?

A few things:
(a) Perhaps the `ops` package will be excluded from Android builds (at least to start with)
(b) IIUC, this class is needed only by the (very very useful) "convenience" classes, a bulk of which will be in the `org.tensorflow.ops` package, right? If so, keeping this separately also more cleanly layers the basic "core" APIs and the APIs to make graph construction much more convenient?
body_html:
Do you think it makes sense for this to be in the org.tensorflow.ops package instead?

A few things:
(a) Perhaps the ops package will be excluded from Android builds (at least to start with)
(b) IIUC, this class is needed only by the (very very useful) "convenience" classes, a bulk of which will be in the org.tensorflow.ops package, right? If so, keeping this separately also more cleanly layers the basic "core" APIs and the APIs to make graph construction much more convenient?
body_text:
Do you think it makes sense for this to be in the org.tensorflow.ops package instead?
A few things:
(a) Perhaps the ops package will be excluded from Android builds (at least to start with)
(b) IIUC, this class is needed only by the (very very useful) "convenience" classes, a bulk of which will be in the org.tensorflow.ops package, right? If so, keeping this separately also more cleanly layers the basic "core" APIs and the APIs to make graph construction much more convenient?
